712611f-a.text:
(1)
40th Street,north side, west from and including Second Avenue.
July 16,1929.
P. L. Sperr.
(2)
The same, from a low roof east of Second avenue. Notice ths Dfogress that has been made in a month's time on the Lefcourt Colonial Building and the Lincoln Building.
August 16,1929.
P. L. Sperr.

712609f-b.text:
305-313 East 40th Street, north side, east of Second Ave., as seen thru clearance on the south side of 40th Street, (former site of Nos. 308-312). Prominent buildings shown are Hotel Tudor (304 East 42nd Street) and the Woodstock Tower (320 East 43nd Street).

Sept. 11, 1931

P.L. Sperr

707873f-a.text:
Second Avenue, front of #893-895 car track area.
President Borough of Manhatten.

April 26, 1921.

712610f-a.text:
East 40th Street, north side, east of Second Avenue. Outstanding is one of the Tudor City units at First Avenue. View 2 is photographed northward from the new roadway that leads to the Queens-Midtown Tunnel.
June 7, 1940
October 3, 1940
P. L. Sperr
